{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3717448,"name":"Rohan","username":"Ras_Al_Ghul","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/r/c89c15/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-08-18T00:30:25.455Z","cooked":"

Learn Onshape Fast with FRC CAD 101:
I’ve launched a beginner-friendly Onshape course that is completely FREE designed specifically for FRC students and teams.
It covers sketching, modeling, assemblies, MkCAD, best practices, and more — all with video lessons and a certificate of completion.

This course is perfect for rookie members or teams looking to improve their CAD game before build season.

Check it out here: FRC CAD 101 | Whop

Edit: I know FRCDesign exists, I created this course because it is video based rather than text based, and for a lot of people this style of learning is preferred.

Hey! Just a heads up, I’m not sure how to feel about you advertising this in the discord server affiliated with FRCDesign without any prior notice, then explicitly ask people to private message you for questions when we have rules regarding YPP in place.

Regardless, if there is an issue with FRCDesign that required you to make your own course, please give us feedback!

Although FRCDesign is an amazing resource I don’t think we should be shaming or downvoting people who create their own resources for any reason, nor should we immediately redirect them to pre-existing ones which they are likely aware of. Now,

Zook:

Haven’t checked the course, but the three reviews were all posted at the same time and have poor grammar. Just a head’s up.

howlongismyname:

Hey! Just a heads up, I’m not sure how to feel about you advertising this in the discord server affiliated with FRCDesign without any prior notice, then explicitly ask people to private message you for questions when we have rules regarding YPP in place.

… those are real problems. But the very fact of one thing in a category existing does not mean that nobody else should make anything in that category.

Thank you for this response, I am very sorry about those reviews, they were written by my friends jokingly. Did not mean to dissuade anyone. Also let me emphasize that this course is completely free, I am not doing this for any personal gain. Additionally, it is video based which I felt might help some people.

i made an account because i have the same common sense of a refrigerator and if i see some, what look like bots, I wanna check it out. Its not a bad resource and is a bunch of videos going over CAD basics made by a student and I honestly like it.

Not a bad website, i like how its more video-based than the text-based FRCdesign.org if im being honest

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-08-18T00:54:06.158Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":277,"readers_count":276,"score":170.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505402,"topic_slug":"frc-cad-101","display_username":"Rohan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":43066,"username":"howlongismyname","name":"david","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/howlongismyname/{size}/134767_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":54282,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Coder"},"post_url":"/t/frc-cad-101/505402/8","custom_user_title":"Coder","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3717708,"name":"Jim Sokoloff","username":"sokoloff","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/sokoloff/{size}/231724_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-18T12:03:53.527Z","cooked":"
pigrammer:

I don’t think we should be shaming or downvoting people who create their own resources for any reason

Completely agree.

pigrammer:

nor should we immediately redirect them to pre-existing ones

Completely disagree here.

There are many excellent resources for FRC self-education (and FRCDesign is certainly in the top tier of these) and it serves the overall CD/FRC community well when a self-education topic comes up to direct new users (some of who may have come to this thread via search and surely some of whom do NOT know about FRCDesign) to be aware of other excellent resources.

If I made a documentation site for programming FRC bots in Java, it would be best for users if someone (ideally me) also linked to WPILib docs. If I made a new dashboard, it would be best for users if someone mentioned Elastic, Glass, et al when appropriate.

I view threads like this as serving the CD community more than serving the needs of the thread originator or pushing one product over another.

Edit to add: I signed up for this course and the outline and intro video look excellent, so I’ll also check this out to maybe use this season.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-08-18T12:17:57.929Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":196.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":505402,"topic_slug":"frc-cad-101","display_username":"Jim Sokoloff","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":10}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66298,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"97 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/frc-cad-101/505402/10","custom_user_title":"97 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":10}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":10,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3717836,"name":"Tom","username":"Zook","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/zook/{size}/252720_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-18T15:04:58.070Z","cooked":"
sokoloff:

Completely disagree here

I see the issue as posting a link to a website with no context or comment. Feels a bit like telling the OP that their post is not needed. Not sure if that was pigrammer’s intent, but that’s how I read it.

We see it very often with new scouting platforms. True, it would be best if the creator informs the forum that they are aware of existing resources and explain why they felt it necessary to add to the pool. But when most of the replies are just links to more established platforms, it feels a little rude.
